summary: This bill, the Foreign Military Sales Reform Act of 2025, modifies dollar amount thresholds for reporting requirements related to the transfer of defense articles and services under the Arms Export Control Act. It increases these thresholds, mandates a report from the Office of the Inspector General of the Department of State on circumventing these thresholds, prohibits federal employees from structuring transfers to avoid reporting, and imposes penalties on Department of State employees who violate these provisions.
